awd_titl_txt: Marine Biological Diversity and Systematics: A Proposed     Workshop to Begin to Develop an NSF Research Initiative
awd_abstract_narration: Biological diversity has been changing and continues to change in               nearly  all  habitats  on  earth and it  is  now  well-recognized               nationally and internationally that there is an urgent  need  for               research programs specifically on issues of biological diversity.               This  projects  supports  the  workshop  on  a  Special  Research               Initiative  on Marine Biological Diversity and Systematics.   The               objective of the workshop is to bring together leading biological               oceanographers and marine biologists to discuss whether there  is               an  urgent need for this program in Ocean Sciences and to  define               the nature and substance of such a program.  The ultimate goal is               to  include  this  research  in the  Long-Range  Plan  for  Ocean               Sciences.  Biological diversity, its causes,  and  the  potential               fragility  of  biotic  systems in the face of  knowledge  of  the               species comprising a system, and rigorous species identifications               require a healthy science of systematics.
